</li>
<li id="cite_note-1996,_p._47-84"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1996,_p._47_84-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFEhsan_Yarshater1996">Ehsan Yarshater (1996). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=WBAZAQAAIAAJ&amp;q=%28Meyer+p.85%29" rel="nofollow"><i>Encyclopaedia Iranica</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/Routledge" title="Routledge">Routledge</a> &amp; Kegan Paul. p.Â 47. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>Â <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-56859-028-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-56859-028-8"><bdi>978-1-56859-028-8</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Encyclopaedia+Iranica&amp;rft.pages=47&amp;rft.pub=Routledge+%26+Kegan+Paul&amp;rft.date=1996&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-56859-028-8&amp;rft.au=Ehsan+Yarshater&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DWBAZAQAAIAAJ%26q%3D%2528Meyer%2Bp.85%2529&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Cook-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Cook_85-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">While estimates for the Achaemenid Empire range from 10â80+ million, most prefer 50 million. Prevas (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=1S-Q-6jDZ7AC&amp;pg=PA14" rel="nofollow">2009, p. 14</a>) estimates 10 million. Strauss (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=nQFtMcD5dOsC&amp;pg=PA37" rel="nofollow">2004, p. 37</a>) estimates about 20 million. Ward (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=8eUTLaaVOOQC&amp;pg=PA16" rel="nofollow">2009, p. 16</a>) estimates at 20 million. Scheidel (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=6vnkts2rOJUC&amp;pg=PA99" rel="nofollow">2009, p. 99</a>) estimates 35 million. Daniel (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=AzqbYf9Q_2UC&amp;pg=PA41" rel="nofollow">2001, p. 41</a>) estimates at 50 million. Meyer and Andreades (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Uwn9d01zMvAC&amp;pg=PA58" rel="nofollow">2004, p. 58</a>) estimates to 50 million. Jones (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=75ueY2rqTYMC&amp;pg=PA8" rel="nofollow">2004, p. 8</a>) estimates over 50 million. Richard (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=toJI-Z_WAC0C&amp;pg=PA34" rel="nofollow">2008, p. 34</a>) estimates nearly 70 million. Hanson (<a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/carnageculturela00hans" rel="nofollow">2001, p. 32</a>) estimates almost 75 million. Cowley (<a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=l6JmAAAAMAAJ" rel="nofollow">1999 and 2001, p. 17</a>) estimates possibly 80 million.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-86">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/largest-empire-by-percentage-of-world-population/" rel="nofollow">"Largest empire by percentage of world population"</a>. Guinness World Records<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 March</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Largest+empire+by+percentage+of+world+population&amp;rft.pub=Guinness+World+Records&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.guinnessworldrecords.com%2Fworld-records%2Flargest-empire-by-percentage-of-world-population%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-Abdullah2014-132"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Abdullah2014_132-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Abdullah2014_132-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFThabit_Abdullah2014">Thabit Abdullah (12 May 2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=ObeOAwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT56" rel="nofollow"><i>A Short History of Iraq</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-152"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-152">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGingeras2016">Gingeras, Ryan (2016). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=sGyMCwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA166" rel="nofollow"><i>Fall of the Sultanate: The Great War and the End of the Ottoman Empire 1908â1922</i></a>. Oxford University Press, Oxford. p.Â 166. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>Â <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-19-166358-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-19-166358-1"><bdi>978-0-19-166358-1</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 June</span> 2016</span>. <q>By January, Ottoman regulars and cavalry detachments associated with the old Hamidiye had seized the towns of Urmia, Khoy, and Salmas. Demonstrations of resistance by local Christians, comprising Armenians, Nestorians, Syriacs, and Assyrians, led Ottoman forces to massacre civilians and torch villages throughout the border region of Iran.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Fall+of+the+Sultanate%3A+The+Great+War+and+the+End+of+the+Ottoman+Empire+1908%E2%80%931922&amp;rft.pages=166&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press%2C+Oxford&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-19-166358-1&amp;rft.aulast=Gingeras&amp;rft.aufirst=Ryan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DsGyMCwAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA166&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Kevorkian2011-153"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Kevorkian2011_153-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKevorkian2011"><a href="/wiki/Raymond_K%C3%A9vorkian" title="Raymond KÃ©vorkian">Kevorkian, Raymond</a> (2011). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=mZ33AgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA710" rel="nofollow"><i>The Armenian Genocide: A Complete History</i></a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">18 June</span> 2016</span>. <q>'In retaliation, we killed the Armenians of Khoy, and I gave the order to massacre the Armenians of Maku.'<span class="nowrap">Â </span>... Without distorting the facts, one can affirm that the centuries-old Armenian presence in the regions of Urmia, Salmast, Qaradagh, and Maku had been dealt a blow from which it would never recover.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Armenian+Genocide%3A+A+Complete+History&amp;rft.pages=710&amp;rft.pub=I.B.+Tauris&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-85773-020-6&amp;rft.aulast=Kevorkian&amp;rft.aufirst=Raymond&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DmZ33AgAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA710&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-154"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-154">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFYeghiayan1991">Yeghiayan, Vartkes, ed. <li id="cite_note-Borrini-FeyerabendFarvar2013-217"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Borrini-FeyerabendFarvar2013_217-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGrazia_Borrini-FeyerabendM._Taghi_FarvarYves_RenardMichel_P_Pimbert2013">Grazia Borrini-Feyerabend; M. Taghi Farvar; Yves Renard; Michel P Pimbert; Ashish Kothari (2013). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=MfS3AAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA120" rel="nofollow"><i>Sharing Power: A Global Guide to Collaborative Management of Natural Resources</i></a>. Routledge. p.Â 120. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>Â <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-136-55742-2" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-136-55742-2"><bdi>978-1-136-55742-2</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Sharing+Power%3A+A+Global+Guide+to+Collaborative+Management+of+Natural+Resources&amp;rft.pages=120&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-136-55742-2&amp;rft.au=Grazia+Borrini-Feyerabend&amp;rft.au=M.+Taghi+Farvar&amp;rft.au=Yves+Renard&amp;rft.au=Michel+P+Pimbert&amp;rft.au=Ashish+Kothari&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DMfS3AAAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA120&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-302"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-302">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7725951.stm" rel="nofollow">"Iran tests new long-range missile"</a>. <i>BBC</i>. 12 November 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-309"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-309">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.hrw.org/news/2018/02/24/iran-stop-prosecuting-women-over-dress-code" rel="nofollow">"Iran: Stop Prosecuting Women Over Dress Code"</a>. <li id="cite_note-310"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-310">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.hrw.org/news/2018/02/07/iran-three-child-offenders-executed" rel="nofollow">"Iran: Three Child Offenders Executed"</a>. Human Rights Watch. 2018.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Iran%3A+Three+Child+Offenders+Executed&amp;rft.pub=Human+Rights+Watch&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hrw.org%2Fnews%2F2018%2F02%2F07%2Firan-three-child-offenders-executed&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-311"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-311">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFFreedom_House2017">Freedom House (2017). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170517002547/https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2017/iran" rel="nofollow">"Iran"</a>. <i>Freedom in the World 2017</i>. Freedom House. Archived from <a class="external text" href="https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2017/iran" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 17 May 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 May</span> 2017</span>. <q>The Islamic Republic of Iran holds elections regularly, but they fall short of democratic standards due to the role of the hard-line Guardian Council, which disqualifies all candidates deemed insufficiently loyal to the clerical establishment. Ultimate power rests in the hands of the country's <a href="/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran" title="Supreme Leader of Iran">supreme leader</a>, Ayatollah <a href="/wiki/Ali_Khamenei" title="Ali Khamenei">Ali Khamenei</a>, and the unelected institutions under his control. Human rights abuses continued unabated in 2016, with the authorities carrying out Iran's largest mass execution in years and launching a renewed crackdown on women's rights activists. The regime maintained restrictions on freedom of expression, both offline and online, and made further arrests of journalists, bloggers, labor union activists, and dual nationals visiting the country, with some facing heavy prison sentences. Hard-liners controlling powerful institutions, including the judiciary and the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), were behind many of the year's abuses. There were no indications that President Hassan Rouhani, a self-proclaimed moderate seeking reelection in 2017, was willing or able to push back against repressive forces and deliver the greater social freedoms he had promised. Opposition leaders Mir Hossein Mousavi, his wife Zahra Rahnavard, and reformist cleric Mehdi Karroubi remained under house arrest for a sixth year without being formally charged or put on trial. As in 2015, the media were barred from quoting or reporting on former president Mohammad Khatami, another important reformist figure.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Freedom+in+the+World+2017&amp;rft.atitle=Iran&amp;rft.date=2017&amp;rft.au=Freedom+House&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ffreedomhouse.org%2Freport%2Ffreedom-world%2F2017%2Firan&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-312"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-312">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFAvery2019">Avery, Daniel (4 April 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.newsweek.com/73-countries-where-its-illegal-be-gay-1385974" rel="nofollow">"71 Countries Where Homosexuality is Illegal"</a>. <i>Newsweek</i>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Newsweek&amp;rft.atitle=71+Countries+Where+Homosexuality+is+Illegal&amp;rft.date=2019-04-04&amp;rft.aulast=Avery&amp;rft.aufirst=Daniel&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newsweek.com%2F73-countries-where-its-illegal-be-gay-1385974&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-320"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-320">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFMihalcik">Mihalcik, Carrie. <a class="external text" href="https://www.cnet.com/news/irans-internet-has-been-shut-down-for-days-amid-protests/" rel="nofollow">"Iran's internet has been shut down for days amid protests"</a>. <i>CNET</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20191126051521/https://www.cnet.com/news/irans-internet-has-been-shut-down-for-days-amid-protests/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 26 November 2019<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-una-393"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-una_393-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFAsia-Pacific_Population_Journal">Asia-Pacific Population Journal, United Nations. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090214041911/http://www.un.org/Depts/escap/pop/journal/v10n1a1.htm" rel="nofollow">"A New Direction in Population Policy and Family Planning in the Islamic Republic of Iran"</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-466"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-466">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFKhalaj2010">Khalaj, Mehrnosh (10 February 2010). <span class="cs1-lock-subscription" title="Paid subscription required"><a class="external text" href="https://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/5a5c0444-1669-11df-bf44-00144feab49a.html?ftcamp=rss" rel="nofollow">"Iran's oldest craft left behind"</a></span>. <li id="cite_note-Unesco.org_November_29_2015c-503"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Unesco.org_November_29_2015c_503-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.unesco.org/culture/ich/en/proclamation-of-masterpieces-00103" rel="nofollow">"Proclamation of the Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity (2001â2005) â intangible heritage â Culture Sector â UNESCO"</a>. <i>Unesco.org</i>. 2000<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-519"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-519">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLeviton,_Richard2014">Leviton, Richard (16 July 2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=IhhOBAAAQBAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>The Mertowney Mountain Interviews</i></a>. <a href="/wiki/IUniverse" title="IUniverse">iUniverse</a>. p.Â 252. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>Â <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4917-4129-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4917-4129-0"><bdi>978-1-4917-4129-0</bdi></a>. <q>...<span class="nowrap">Â </span>the summer solstice festival, called <i>Tiregan</i>,<span class="nowrap">Â </span>...</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Mertowney+Mountain+Interviews&amp;rft.pages=252&amp;rft.pub=iUniverse&amp;rft.date=2014-07-16&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4917-4129-0&amp;rft.au=Leviton%2C+Richard&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DIhhOBAAAQBAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-571"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-571">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://www.radiofarda.com/a/f12-iranian-beauty-contest-hel-in-canda/25388427.html" rel="nofollow">"ÙØ³Ø§Ø¨ÙÙ ÙÙÚ©Ù Ø²ÛØ¨Ø§ÛÛ Ø§ÛØ±Ø§Ù Ø¯Ø± Ú©Ø§ÙØ§Ø¯Ø§"</a>. <i>Ø±Ø§Ø¯ÛÙ ÙØ±Ø¯Ø§</i> (in Persian)<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 June</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%AF%DB%8C%D9%88+%D9%81%D8%B1%D8%AF%D8%A7&amp;rft.atitle=%D9%85%D8%B3%D8%A7%D8%A8%D9%82%D9%87+%D9%85%D9%84%DA%A9%D9%87+%D8%B2%DB%8C%D8%A8%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C+%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86+%D8%AF%D8%B1+%DA%A9%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AF%D8%A7&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.radiofarda.com%2Fa%2Ff12-iranian-beauty-contest-hel-in-canda%2F25388427.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIran"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-572"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-572">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://www.dw.com/fa-ir/%D9%85%D9%84%DA%A9%D9%87-%D8%B2%DB%8C%D8%A8%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C-%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86%DB%8C%D8%AA%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%AF%D8%B1-%D8%B4%D9%88-%D8%AA%D9%84%D9%88%DB%8C%D8%B2%DB%8C%D9%88%D9%86%DB%8C-%D8%A2%D9%84%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86-%D9%85%DB%8C%D8%B1%D9%82%D8%B5%D8%AF/g-36311497" rel="nofollow">"ÙÙÚ©Ù Ø²ÛØ¨Ø§ÛÛ Ø§ÛØ±Ø§ÙÛâØªØ¨Ø§Ø± Ø¯Ø± Ø´Ù ØªÙÙÛØ²ÛÙÙÛ "Ø¢ÙÙØ§Ù ÙÛâØ±ÙØµØ¯"<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>"</a>. <i>Deutsche Welle</i> (in Persian). 8 November 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. <div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="23x15px&amp;#124;border_&amp;#124;alt=Iran&amp;#124;link=Iran_Iran_topics" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible expanded navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Iran_topics" title="Template:Iran topics"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Iran_topics" title="Template talk:Iran topics"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Iran_topics&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="23x15px&amp;#124;border_&amp;#124;alt=Iran&amp;#124;link=Iran_Iran_topics" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><span style="position:relative; <ul><li><a href="/wiki/Kura%E2%80%93Araxes_culture" title="KuraâAraxes culture">Kura-Araxes <span class="nowrap">culture (3400â2000 BC)</span></a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Proto-Elamite" title="Proto-Elamite">Proto-Elamite <span class="nowrap">civilization (3100â2700 BC)</span></a></li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><i>defunct</i></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

</div></td><td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="2" style="width:1px;padding:0 0 0 2px"><div><div class="floatright"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Flag_of_Iran.svg" title="Flag of Iran"><img alt="Flag of Iran" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="360" data-file-width="630" decoding="async" height="23" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Flag_of_Iran.svg/40px-Flag_of_Iran.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Flag_of_Iran.svg/60px-Flag_of_Iran.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Flag_of_Iran.svg/80px-Flag_of_Iran.svg.png 2x" width="40"/></a></div></div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Natural</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dasht-e_Loot" title="Dasht-e Loot">Lut Desert</a></li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Nations_in_the_Group_of_15_(G-15)" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:G-15_nations" title="Template:G-15 nations"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:G-15_nations" title="Template talk:G-15 nations"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:G-15_nations&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Nations_in_the_Group_of_15_(G-15)" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Group_of_15" title="Group of 15">Nations in the Group of 15 (G-15)</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Summits</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
